newsitem.title: CHINA: Sanction-hit China firm denies chemical exports.
newsitem.headline: Sanction-hit China firm denies chemical exports.

text.p: A Chinese company hit by U.S. sanctions denied on Friday it had sold to Iran chemicals that could be used in making chemical weapons.

"We have never sold any chemicals, chemical products or equipment to Iran," an official of the Jiangsu Yongli Chemical Engineering and Technology Import/Export Corp, said by telephone from the eastern city of Nanjing.
Sanction-hit China firm denies chemical exports
Jiangsu Yongli, the export arm of its parent company, Nanjing Chemical Industries Group, exports mainly to Southeast Asian countries, the official said.
The official said the company abides by government regulations concerning exports of chemicals.

The United States toughened its position on China on Thursday, imposing new sanctions on Jiangsu Yongli and Nanjing Chemical Industries Group for allegedly transferring chemical weapons components to Iran.
The U.S. State Department said there was no evidence the Chinese government was involved in the transfers, which involved chemicals and other technology that could be used in chemical wapons.
